required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PK Study of Dapagliflozin in Pediatric Subjects With T2DM
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Multi-Center, Parallel Group, Single-Dose, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics Study of Dapagliflozin in Children and Adolescents Aged 10 to 17 Years With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate the pharmacokinetics (PK) of Dapagliflozin in pediatric subjects with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM)

detailed_description.textblock: Primary purpose: The primary purpose is to assess the pharmacokinetics of a single dose of Dapagliflozin in the range of 2.5 to 10 mg in pediatric subjects aged 10 to 17 years with T2DM

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Dapagliflozin
primary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) was measured by plasma concentration of Dapagliflozin over time. The geometric means are reported in nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Median Time of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Dapagliflozin
primary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Time of maximum observed plasma concentration (Tmax) for Dapagliflozin was derived from plasma concentrations versus time data. Medians were reported in hours (h).

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time [AUC(INF)] of Dapagliflozin
primary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time was derived from concentration versus time data. Geometric means are reported in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*hr/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration [AUC(0-T)] of Dapagliflozin
primary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to time of the last quantifiable concentration (AUC(0-T)) was measured by plasma concentration of Dapagliflozin over time. The geometric means are reported in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*h/mL).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Plasma half-life (T-Half) for Dapagliflozin was derived from plasma concentrations versus time data. Means are reported in hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Apparent Clearance After Extravascular Administration (CL/F) of Dapagliflozin
primary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Apparent clearance after extravascular administration (CL/F) of Dapagliflozin was derived from plasma concentrations versus time data. Geometric means are reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Apparent Volume of Distribution at Terminal Phase After Extravascular Administration (Vz/F) of Dapagliflozin
primary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Geometric mean of apparent volume of distribution at terminal phase after extravascular administration of Dapagliflozin was derived from plasma concentration versus time data. Geometric means are reported in Liters (L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Dapagliflozin 3-O-Glucuronide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) was measured by plasma concentration of Dapagliflozin 3-O-Glucuronide over time. The geometric means are reported in nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Dapagliflozin 3-O-Glucuronide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Time of maximum observed plasma concentration (Tmax) for Dapagliflozin 3-O-Glucuronide was derived from plasma concentrations versus time data. Medians were reported in hours (h).

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time [AUC(INF)] of Dapagliflozin 3-O-Glucuronide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time was derived from concentration versus time data. Geometric means are reported in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*hr/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration [AUC(0-T)] of Dapagliflozin 3-O-Glucuronide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to time of the last quantifiable concentration (AUC(0-T)) was measured by plasma concentration of Dapagliflozin 3-O-Glucuronide over time. The geometric means are reported in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*h/mL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 11 time points: Immediately pre-dose, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.5, 4, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma half-life (T-Half) for Dapagliflozin was derived from plasma concentration versus time data. Means are reported in hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Fasting Plasma Glucose Concentrations at Pre-dose on Day 1 and on Day 2 After an 8-hr Fasting
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma glucose concentrations were evaluated in all treated subjects at Day 1 pre-dose and at Day 2 after fasting for 8 hours. Means are reported in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose From Baseline Until Day 2
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma glucose concentrations were evaluated in all treated subjects at Day 1 pre-dose and at Day 2 after fasting for 8 hours. Mean change from baseline to Day 2 is reported in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Total Amount of Glucose Excreted in Urine Over 24 Hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of dose to 24 hours post-dose, Day 1 to Day 2
secondary_outcome.description: The total amount of glucose excreted in urine was measured for 24 hours following administration of Dapagliflozin. Means are reported in grams.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Vital Sign Abnormalities, Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities, or Physical Examination Abnormalities Following Study Drug Administration.
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were followed from dosing on Day 1 until study discharge on Day 3. The number of participants with investigator-assessed clinically-important abnormalities in vital sign measurements, ECGs or physical examinations was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Marked Hematology Laboratory Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose (Day -1). Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Hemoglobin (grams per deciliter:g/dL): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Hematocrit (%): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Platelet Count (x10^9 cells per liter:c/L): <0.85*LLN or >1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx). Leukocytes (x10^3 cells per microliter: c/uL): <0.9*LLN, >1.2*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx or >ULN, if Pre- Rx>ULN, use >1.15*Pre-Rx or <LLN). Neutrophils (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): <=1.5. Lymphocytes (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): <0.75 or >7.5. Monocytes (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): >2.000. Basophils (x10^3 c/uL): >0.4. Eosinophils (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): >0.75. Blasts (Absolute) (x10^9 c/L) > 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Marked Serum Chemistry Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Alkaline Phosphatase (units per liter: U/L), Aspartate Aminotransferase (U/L), Alanine Aminotransferase (U/L): >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Bilirubin (milligrams per deciliter: mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Blood Urea Nitrogen (mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.2*Pre-Rx). Creatinine (micromoles per Liter (umol/L)): >1.5*ULN if Pre-Rx missing or <= ULN, >1.33*Pre-Rx if PreRx > ULN. Sodium (mmol/L): >1.05*ULN, 1.05*Pre-Rx if Pre-Rx>ULN: <0.95*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.05*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Potassium(mmol/L), Chloride (mmol/L), Calcium(mmol/L): <0.9*LLN, >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Phosphorus (mg/dL): <0.85*LLN, >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, <0.85*Pre-Rx, >ULN. if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx, <LLN).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Marked Abnormalities in Other Chemistry Testing
secondary_outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Glucose, fasting serum (mmol/L): <0.8*LLN, >1.3*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.8*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >2.0*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Protein (grams per deciliter: g/L): <0.9*LLN, >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Albumin (g/L): <0.9*LLN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx). Uric Acid (mmol/L): >1.2*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx). Lactate Dehydrogenase (U/L): >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.5*Pre-Rx)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Marked Urinalysis Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Blood, urine (Qualitative): >=2 (If Pre-Rx >= 1, >=2*Pre-Rx). Glucose, urine (Qualitative): >=1, (If Pre-Rx >=1, >=2*Pre-Rx). Protein, urine (Qualitative): >=2 (If Pre-Rx >=1, >=2*Pre-Rx). Red Blood Cells (RBC), urine (RBC per High Power Field (hpf)): >=2 (If Pre-Rx>=2, >=4). White Blood Cells (WBC), urine (hpf): >=2 (If Pre-Rx>=2, >=4).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of T2DM
- Male and female subjects ages 10-17
- Glycosylated Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) ≥6 to 10%
- Body weight ≥30 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Fasting plasma glucose (FPG) >240 mg/dL at screening
- Abnormal renal function
- Active liver disease and/or significant abnormal liver function

facility.name: Kosair Charities Pediatric Clinical Research Unit
Women And Children'S Hopsital Of Buffalo
Children'S Hospital Of Pittsburgh Of Upmc

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 53 participants enrolled; 24 randomized; 24 treated with study drug. 29 participants were not randomized due to no longer meeting study criteria (25), withdrawal of consent (2), or other reasons (2).

measure.title: Age
Age, Customized
Sex: Female, Male

outcome.population: All treated participants with evaluable pharmacodynamic (PD) profiles

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Marked Hematology Laboratory Abnormalities
outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose (Day -1). Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Hemoglobin (grams per deciliter:g/dL): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Hematocrit (%): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Platelet Count (x10^9 cells per liter:c/L): <0.85*LLN or >1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx). Leukocytes (x10^3 cells per microliter: c/uL): <0.9*LLN, >1.2*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx or >ULN, if Pre- Rx>ULN, use >1.15*Pre-Rx or <LLN). Neutrophils (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): <=1.5. Lymphocytes (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): <0.75 or >7.5. Monocytes (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): >2.000. Basophils (x10^3 c/uL): >0.4. Eosinophils (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): >0.75. Blasts (Absolute) (x10^9 c/L) > 0.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Pre-dose) to Day 3
outcome.population: All treated participants

measure.title: Number of Participants With Marked Hematology Laboratory Abnormalities
measure.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose (Day -1). Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Hemoglobin (grams per deciliter:g/dL): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Hematocrit (%): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Platelet Count (x10^9 cells per liter:c/L): <0.85*LLN or >1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx). Leukocytes (x10^3 cells per microliter: c/uL): <0.9*LLN, >1.2*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx or >ULN, if Pre- Rx>ULN, use >1.15*Pre-Rx or <LLN). Neutrophils (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): <=1.5. Lymphocytes (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): <0.75 or >7.5. Monocytes (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): >2.000. Basophils (x10^3 c/uL): >0.4. Eosinophils (Absolute) (x10^3 c/uL): >0.75. Blasts (Absolute) (x10^9 c/L) > 0.
measure.population: All treated participants

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Marked Serum Chemistry Abnormalities
outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Alkaline Phosphatase (units per liter: U/L), Aspartate Aminotransferase (U/L), Alanine Aminotransferase (U/L): >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Bilirubin (milligrams per deciliter: mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Blood Urea Nitrogen (mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.2*Pre-Rx). Creatinine (micromoles per Liter (umol/L)): >1.5*ULN if Pre-Rx missing or <= ULN, >1.33*Pre-Rx if PreRx > ULN. Sodium (mmol/L): >1.05*ULN, 1.05*Pre-Rx if Pre-Rx>ULN: <0.95*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.05*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Potassium(mmol/L), Chloride (mmol/L), Calcium(mmol/L): <0.9*LLN, >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Phosphorus (mg/dL): <0.85*LLN, >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, <0.85*Pre-Rx, >ULN. if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx, <LLN).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Pre-dose) to Day 3
outcome.population: All treated participants

measure.title: Number of Participants With Marked Serum Chemistry Abnormalities
measure.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Alkaline Phosphatase (units per liter: U/L), Aspartate Aminotransferase (U/L), Alanine Aminotransferase (U/L): >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Bilirubin (milligrams per deciliter: mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Blood Urea Nitrogen (mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.2*Pre-Rx). Creatinine (micromoles per Liter (umol/L)): >1.5*ULN if Pre-Rx missing or <= ULN, >1.33*Pre-Rx if PreRx > ULN. Sodium (mmol/L): >1.05*ULN, 1.05*Pre-Rx if Pre-Rx>ULN: <0.95*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.05*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Potassium(mmol/L), Chloride (mmol/L), Calcium(mmol/L): <0.9*LLN, >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Phosphorus (mg/dL): <0.85*LLN, >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, <0.85*Pre-Rx, >ULN. if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx, <LLN).
measure.population: All treated participants

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Marked Abnormalities in Other Chemistry Testing
outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Glucose, fasting serum (mmol/L): <0.8*LLN, >1.3*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.8*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >2.0*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Protein (grams per deciliter: g/L): <0.9*LLN, >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Albumin (g/L): <0.9*LLN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx). Uric Acid (mmol/L): >1.2*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx). Lactate Dehydrogenase (U/L): >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.5*Pre-Rx)
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Pre-dose) to Day 3
outcome.population: All treated participants

measure.title: Number of Participants With Marked Abnormalities in Other Chemistry Testing
measure.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Glucose, fasting serum (mmol/L): <0.8*LLN, >1.3*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.8*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >2.0*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Protein (grams per deciliter: g/L): <0.9*LLN, >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Albumin (g/L): <0.9*LLN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx). Uric Acid (mmol/L): >1.2*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx). Lactate Dehydrogenase (U/L): >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.5*Pre-Rx)
measure.population: All treated participants

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Marked Urinalysis Abnormalities
outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Blood, urine (Qualitative): >=2 (If Pre-Rx >= 1, >=2*Pre-Rx). Glucose, urine (Qualitative): >=1, (If Pre-Rx >=1, >=2*Pre-Rx). Protein, urine (Qualitative): >=2 (If Pre-Rx >=1, >=2*Pre-Rx). Red Blood Cells (RBC), urine (RBC per High Power Field (hpf)): >=2 (If Pre-Rx>=2, >=4). White Blood Cells (WBC), urine (hpf): >=2 (If Pre-Rx>=2, >=4).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Pre-dose) to Day 3
outcome.population: All treated participants with evaluable lab results

measure.title: Number of Participants With Marked Urinalysis Abnormalities
measure.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Blood, urine (Qualitative): >=2 (If Pre-Rx >= 1, >=2*Pre-Rx). Glucose, urine (Qualitative): >=1, (If Pre-Rx >=1, >=2*Pre-Rx). Protein, urine (Qualitative): >=2 (If Pre-Rx >=1, >=2*Pre-Rx). Red Blood Cells (RBC), urine (RBC per High Power Field (hpf)): >=2 (If Pre-Rx>=2, >=4). White Blood Cells (WBC), urine (hpf): >=2 (If Pre-Rx>=2, >=4).
measure.population: All treated participants with evaluable lab results

reported_events.time_frame: SAEs collected from Screening (up to 28 days before first dose) to 30 days after last dose; Non-serious AEs collected from time of dose (Day 1) to Study Discharge (Day 3) and followed until resolution, stabilization, or reclassification as SAE.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
